newsitem.title: ITALY: Europa Metalli H1 1996 gross profit 24 bln lire.
newsitem.headline: Europa Metalli H1 1996 gross profit 24 bln lire.

text.p: Europa Metalli, the Italian unit of the SMI group's KM Europa Metal Ag, posted first half 1996 gross profit of 24.4 billion lire.
A company statement said the result was not comparable with the same 1995 period as a result of group restructuring. SMI transferred Italian activities to KM Europa Metal only from June 1, 1995.
First half turnover was 552.5 billion lire with investments of 15.2 billion lire and cash flow of 49.2 billion lire.
The company said it was difficult to make forecasts for the second half because of continuing uncertainty in the sector. "At the moment there are no signs of recovery," it said.
But due to the restructuring, the firm was able to envisage results maintaining a positive trend, "as long as the current recessionary phase does not get worse."
